radiographic_examinations.findings: marked mid-line shift in the direction opposite the craniectomy site with subfalcine herniation and effacement of the peripontine cisterns
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up brain CT scan confirmed resolution of the tissue shifts and herniation

radiographic_examinations.findings: very high N-acetyl aspartate (NAA)/choline (Cho) ratio for age, excess of glutamate/glutamine, and large lipid peaks in the thalamus, white matter, and cortex
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRS at 3 years showed no lipid signals detected and all the metabolite ratios are normal for age

radiographic_examinations.findings: acute coccidioidomycosis infection suspected but excluded by negative serology
disruption of the internal elastic lamina with a central luminal thrombus
